message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: int count = 0;
int previousValue = -1;
for (int value : integers) {
    if (value != previousValue) {
        count++;
        previousValue = value;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this solution, we initialize a count variable to keep track of the number of transitions. We also initialize a previousValue variable to store the previous value in the list. We then iterate through the list using a for-each loop. If the current value is different from the previous value, we increment the count and update the previousValue. At the end of the loop, the count variable will contain the number of times the value has changed within the collection.
